channel.title: Graphing calculator programming
channel.description:
Somebody's given me a Casio FX-9750GA graphing calculator and I noticed that you can write programs on it. I found out how to do basic stuff like printing strings, doing calculations and setting variables but I have no idea, for example, about the syntax of if statements and how to use the graph functions.
I don't have a manual for it and neither does the person who gave it to me, so I'm looking for some documentation on how to program using this. I don't know what the language is but I imagine it's very similar, if not the same, on all graphing calculators.

item.title: Graphing calculator programming
item.dc:creator: @bt1 bt
item.description:
@bt1 wrote:

TI Basic. Most ridiculous syntax ever (imo). The programs tend to just not read well.

Read full topic

http://support.casio.com/manuallist.php?rgn=1&cid=004

The 9750GA isn’t listed, but some that are closely related to it are.

Read full topic

@zstars wrote:

No, they’re not the same, DL the manual.
